column5: The Masters in International Social Welfare is distinctive in the ways in which it:develops a conceptual and theoretical understanding of global social issues, with a particular focus on the role of social work and social policy in addressing poverty and inequality and promoting human rights, social justice and social developmentprovides a knowledge and understanding that will enable you to work in a variety of different social work and social development settings at local, national and international levelsYou'll be encouraged to develop a critical understanding of global social issues and relate this knowledge to developments in a context of relevance to you, be that your own country or profession.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
